Vrms was written by [[Bdale Garbee]] and Bill Geddes for the [[Debian GNU/Linux]] system, in response to an open discussion with [[Richard Stallman]] about the issues surrounding the availability/desirability of the ânon-freeâ package tree in Debian.
In 2005, [[RogÃ©rio Brito]], motivated to improve the status of the package status, looked at and fixed some long, outstanding bugs reported in Debian's Bug Tracking System, and, shortly afterwards, the project moved to a more distributed and cooperative development with a mailing list being created and with the source code being put in a Subversion version control system hosted by [[Alioth (Debian)|Alioth]]'s Debian server.
In 2005, [[RogÃ©rio Brito]], motivated to improve the status of the package status, looked at and fixed some long, outstanding bugs reported in Debian's Bug Tracking System, and, shortly afterwards, the project moved to a more distributed and cooperative development with a mailing list being created and with the source code being put in a Subversion version control system hosted by [[Alioth (Debian)|Alioth]]'s Debian server.
